name: Person Location
description: The PL data type is used to specify the location of a person within a healthcare facility or organization. It provides detailed location information including point of care, room, bed, facility, and building details. PL enables precise tracking of patient locations, provider assignments, and resource allocation within complex healthcare environments, supporting patient safety, workflow optimization, and emergency response systems.

PL.1.name: Point of Care
PL.1.description: The point of care unit or area where the person is located (e.g., Emergency Department, ICU, Operating Room). Represents the primary care delivery location within the facility.

PL.2.name: Room
PL.2.description: The specific room number or identifier where the person is located. Provides room-level location precision within the point of care.

PL.3.name: Bed
PL.3.description: The specific bed number or identifier where the person is located. Provides bed-level location precision for patient tracking and care coordination.

PL.4.name: Facility
PL.4.description: The healthcare facility or organization where the person is located. Identifies the institution for multi-facility healthcare systems.

PL.5.name: Location Status
PL.5.description: The current status of the location (e.g., active, inactive, housekeeping). Indicates availability and operational status of the location.

PL.6.name: Person Location Type
PL.6.description: The type or category of the location (e.g., patient room, nurse station, treatment room). Classifies the functional purpose of the location.

PL.7.name: Building
PL.7.description: The building identifier within a multi-building healthcare campus. Enables location tracking across large healthcare complexes.

PL.8.name: Floor
PL.8.description: The floor number or identifier within the building. Provides vertical location precision for multi-story healthcare facilities.

PL.9.name: Location Description
PL.9.description: A free-text description of the location providing additional context or human-readable location information.

constraints.hierarchy: Location components should follow logical hierarchy (Facility > Building > Floor > Point of Care > Room > Bed)
constraints.consistency: Location identifiers should be consistent with facility naming conventions
constraints.availability: Location status should reflect current operational availability

CARDIO^CCU-01^^Regional Heart Center^A^ROOM^Cardiac Wing^2^Cardiac Care Unit

PV1.6 - Prior Patient Location for patient transfers

generationHints.typical: Use realistic healthcare location hierarchies and naming conventions
rooms: Room numbers (101, 201A), procedure rooms (OR-1, CT-2), specialty units (CCU-01)
beds: A, B, C for multi-bed rooms; single beds use room number
